description.narrative: The development objectives of Enhancing Resilience in Kyrgyzstan Project for Kyrgyz Republic is to support the recipient to strengthen its capacity to respond to disasters, provide safer and improved learning environment for children, and reduce adverse financial impacts of natural hazards on the recipient's budget and population. This project has five components. 1) The first component, Strengthening Disaster Preparedness and Response Systems, aims to strengthen the disaster preparedness and response systems of the Kyrgyz Republic in order to reduce the negative impacts from disasters the country is exposed to, primarily by expanding the crisis management systems to cover the whole country and by increasing the capacity to monitor hazards so that decision makers can prepare for possible hazard impacts. 2) The second component, Improving Safety and Functionality of School Infrastructure, aims to improve the safety and functionality of existing state school infrastructure by supporting the government in the implementation of the State program on safer schools. 3) The third component, Enhancing Financial Protection, aims to turn the State Insurance Organization (SIO) into a professional, modern insurance organization capable of effectively implementing and managing at national scale the mandatory disaster insurance program for private residential property. 4) The fourth component, Project Management and Monitoring and Evaluation, aims to support operating costs incurred by the Project Implementation Unit (PIU) in efficiently and transparently implementing the project activities, and it will build the institutional capacity needed to sustain the project beyond the formal life of the project. 5) The fifth component, Contingent Emergency Response, aims to improve the Kyrgyz Republic's capacity to respond to disasters. condition.narrative: The Recipient shall establish no later than one (1) month after Effective Date and thereafter operate and maintain during theProject implementation, a Project Coordination Council with terms of reference, composition and resources acceptable to theAssociation, including, inter alia, the responsibility for Project-level decision making. (Section I. A.1 in Schedule 2)
The Recipient, through MoES, shall not later than 30 days after the Effective Date, update and adopt the POM in a form andsubstance acceptable to the Association.

title.narrative: Population covered by improved emergency preparedness and response systems in the country
Students (disaggregated by gender) having access to safer and resilient school facilities
Landslides of highest risks are monitored and have an associated emergency plan
School facilities with improvements in functional conditions (fraction of total number of school facilities with improved safety and resilience)
Availability of functioning and mission-ready firefighting vehicles is increased
Firefighting vehicles response travel times in urban areas are decreased
Firefighting vehicles response travel times in rural areas are decreased
Number of new fully equipped and functional intensive care beds financed by the project
Percentage of designated hospitals with personal protection equipment, infection control products, medical supplies and consumables, without stock-outs in preceding two weeks
ICT equipment required to cover the whole country is purchased and installed for improved emergency preparedness and response
Number of ambulances procured, installed and made operational
Grievances raised by stakeholders are addressed and closed
School facilities with improvements in safety, resilience and functional conditions
Web-based insurance production system is developed
Web-based platform is setup and becomes operational
Grievances raised by women stakeholders are addressed and closed
Sets of medical waste management equipment operationalized and functioning through preparing and adopting a proper Infectious Control and Waste Management Plan (ICWMP)
Local engineers trained on advanced seismic risk techniques and design of new school buildings
Number of regional offices of the SIO equipped
Landslide monitoring tasks & needs are defined, and staff trained
Intervention and investment plan for the implementation of State Program on Safe Schools and Preschools of the Kyrgyz Republic for the period of 2015 – 2024 is defined
Monitoring equipment are purchased, installed and operationalized by staff
Risk management system of the SIO is in place
School infrastructure module integrated in the Ministry of Education's Information System, and made accessible to other relevant stakeholders
Percentage of schools with school monitoring committees established and functioning as planned throughout project cycle (Citizen Engagement)
Search and rescue equipment are purchased and being used by teams
Percentage of school monitoring committees established and functioning which include at least 50 percent of women with equal decision-making authority as men (Gender)
Distant Learning System for educating the public is setup and becomes operational
Firefighting service development program is prepared and adopted
Monitoring and evaluation system for firefighting vehicles response travel times is established
Cumulative number of firefighting vehicles placed into services in designated response areas
